title: User Authentication and Multi-Factor Login
summary: Implement secure login with multi-factor authentication for customer access
description: Develop a secure authentication system for the self-service banking portal. This includes user registration, login, and logout functionalities supported by multi-factor authentication mechanisms such as OTP, biometrics, or email verification. The implementation should adhere to banking security standards and ensure encrypted storage of credentials. Additionally, create a password recovery workflow and session management to maintain customer session integrity.

title: Personalized Customer Dashboard
summary: Create a user-specific dashboard displaying banking products and services
description: Design and implement a responsive, intuitive dashboard that presents a personalized overview of the customer’s banking relationship. It should display product details, offers, and actions based on the user’s profile, eligibility, and account data fetched from the core banking system. Include widgets for quick access to frequently used services and provide visual indicators for pending tasks or requests.

title: Responsive UI and Cross-Device Compatibility
summary: Ensure the portal’s interface is responsive across desktop, tablet, and mobile platforms
description: Develop a responsive front-end that adapts seamlessly to different screen sizes and devices, ensuring consistent usability and accessibility. Implement a design system and reusable components that maintain a cohesive look and feel. Optimize the portal’s performance for mobile devices to ensure efficiency and accessibility even on limited bandwidth connections.

title: Account Opening and Service Request Workflows
summary: Enable customers to submit account opening and modification requests through streamlined workflows
description: Build functionality allowing customers to open new accounts, request modifications, or apply for additional services via guided workflows. Each workflow should minimize user effort by auto-filling data where possible. The system should validate inputs, allow saving incomplete applications, and permit users to resume them later. Integrate functionality for users to upload required documentation directly within the interface.

title: Real-Time Notifications and Request Tracking
summary: Provide real-time status tracking and notifications for user submissions
description: Develop a module for customers to view the status of their submitted requests and receive real-time updates. Integrate email notifications and on-portal alerts informing users of any progress, approval, or required action. Maintain a log of communication to enhance transparency and trust.

title: Comprehensive Interaction History
summary: Develop a complete interaction history module for tracking user activities
description: Implement a history tracking feature that captures all customer interactions within the portal such as requests, status updates, account changes, and document submissions. Ensure that the history is easily searchable and filterable by date or category to improve user experience and auditability.

title: Data Security and Compliance Management
summary: Ensure compliance and secure handling of sensitive financial data
description: Introduce robust data security measures compliant with banking regulatory standards and privacy laws. Implement encryption of sensitive data both in transit and at rest, regular security audits, and vulnerability assessments. Maintain role-based access controls to limit data visibility based on authorization levels. Include incident management processes for timely response to potential breaches.

title: Core Banking System Integration
summary: Integrate the self-service portal with the core banking system
description: Develop secure APIs to facilitate data exchange between the self-service portal and the existing core banking system. Ensure seamless synchronization of account details, transactions, and service requests. Use middleware or messaging queues if needed to improve performance, stability, and fault tolerance. Establish monitoring and fallback mechanisms to maintain service continuity.

title: Portal Database and Performance Optimization
summary: Implement a dedicated database for the self-service portal ensuring high reliability and performance
description: Design a separate portal database to store non-core transactional data such as customer session details, workflow states, and documents. Focus on performance optimization, indexing, and efficient data retrieval. Implement caching where applicable to reduce load on the core banking integration and enhance overall responsiveness.
